comments.body:
How bad is it if someone doesn't do this?

Do we need to detect/fail gracefully if this hasn't been done, or as we assuming that people are following the documented process so this should be OK?

The failure mode depends on what they have laying around. If there's an `ansible-doc` already on the path, the generated "new plugins" metadata will be incorrect (based on whatever version it is, likely empty in most cases). If they don't have one, it'll just fail when it tries to run it.

The only way to actually detect it that I can think of (and still not 100% bulletproof, but pretty good) would be to parse the version from `ansible-doc --version` and ensure that it matches what's being requested.
I think it's also important to note that this isn't a new issue. Our current manual instructions also require sourcing of `hacking/env-setup`, with the same consequences if you don't.
